metadata.titel_preek: Twentieth Sunday After Pentecost: Isaiah 45 / Trinity Sunday / Psalm 130

kernfrasen: parent of a child... on the verge of self-destruction
inner core of being is love
pay a ransom, mortgage the house
add up our virtues and balance them
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS DEBT / SALVATION IS RANSOM

kernfrasen: there is no health in us
erred and strayed like lost sheep
straining forward to the approach of the dawn
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A JOURNEY OUT OF DARKNESS

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: You would pay a ransom, mortgage the house... to get your child’s attention.

cognitieve_implicaties: God is not a detached observer but an emotionally vulnerable participant.
theologische_implicaties: The Trinity is defined by outward-pouring sacrifice rather than static essence.
ethische_implicaties: Believers should be willing to 'make fools of themselves' for the sake of others.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Could imply God is reckless or lacks sovereignty if the 'mortgage' fails.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the 'Economic' domain by grounding it in the visceral desperation of a parent in crisis.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: There is no health in us.

cognitieve_implicaties: Sin is not a mistake but a systemic failure of the 'self' container.
theologische_implicaties: Salvation must be an external infusion of life, not self-help.
ethische_implicaties: Humility is the only logical response to spiritual 'illness'.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May lead to a sense of powerlessness or 'paralysis' which the preacher explicitly warns against.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A liturgical phrase that the preacher attempts to revitalize by linking it to the 'primordial catastrophe'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the Relational (Parent) and Economic (Ransom) domains by framing the transaction as an act of love rather than cold justice.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: God as Judge (noting what is done amiss)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The shift from a legal/record-keeping God to a desperate Father is abrupt.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A judge must be impartial; a desperate parent is partial and 'makes a fool of himself'.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'Ransom' is redefined not as a payment to a third party, but as the 'spending' of the self for the beloved.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' Trinitarian formula and breathes life into it through the 'Desperate Parent' schema.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Paul... like a parent agonizing because a child has fallen in with a fast crowd.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing heavily on the parent/child dynamic, the majesty of God might be reduced to human emotionality.
risicos.voorbeeld: You would make a complete fool of yourself if you thought it might get your child’s attention.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God as needy or reactive rather than sovereign.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A modern household in crisis (drugs, anorexia, runaway child).
sub_worlds: The first-century Corinthian church in turmoil.
The 'Depths' (De Profundis) as a dark pit or prison.
The watchman on the city walls waiting for dawn.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective; creates immediate empathy for Paul's 'crabbed' writing style.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeated emphasis on 'plenteous redemption' and 'infinite compassion'.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Repudiating 'petty record keeping' and 'adding up points'.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as the Watchman/Dawn and the Self-Giving Trinity.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strong; uses the BCP and the 'De Profundis' history to ground the cognitive shifts.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational/Familial domain, specifically the 'Desperate Parent' metaphor. This is used to explain the Trinity and the Atonement. It successfully moves away from a cold Juridical/Economic model ('petty record keeping') toward a more dynamic, emotional, and self-sacrificial model of God.

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: Washed in the blood / Spent to the last drop
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain of 'blood' by linking it to the physical exhaustion mentioned in the parent analogy (neglecting health, going without sleep).
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God's love is not a bank account; it is a parent's literal life-blood poured into a failing child.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The 'Fear of the Lord' vs. 'Desperate Parent'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explain 'Fear' as the awe one feels when realizing the sheer scale of the parent's sacrifice, rather than fear of punishment.

entailment_checks.metafoor: SIN IS SICKNESS (no health in us)
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'strayed like sheep' metaphor to emphasize the 'willful' nature of the 'impulse toward self-destruction'.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To provide stability to the 'Trinity' concept which feels very 'tumultuous' in this sermon.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The inner life of the Trinity as a foundation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to make abstract Trinitarian doctrine and the concept of 'Total Depravity' feel viscerally relevant through the schema of parental desperation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'agonized' tone; CMT reveals that this tone is a cognitive tool to map human desperation onto Divine Love.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning cycle, CMT focuses on the underlying conceptual structures (Source/Target) that make the 'experience' of the sermon possible.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is 'overwriting' the Economic/Juridical schema of sin with a Relational/Medical one to bypass the congregation's resistance to being called 'miserable offenders'.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: last ditch of our messed-up lives
appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'depth' both as a spatial metaphor (verticality) and an emotional intensity marker.
